body.p: A study estimated that the mean number of children per family in the the United States is 1.3. This point estimate would be unbiased and most accurate if it were based on which of the following?

multiple_choice.choice: A random sample of 10,000 U.S. families with children from the state of Utah
A random sample of 500 U.S. families with children
A random sample of 5,000 U.S. families with children
A random sample of 1,000 U.S. families

response.feedback: Incorrect. Families in Utah tend to have more than the average number of children, so a point estimate based on this sample would overestimate the true mean despite the very large sample size.
Incorrect. Although it is true that this estimate is based on a random sample (and is therefore unbiased), recall that the larger the sample size, the more accurate the estimate is.
Incorrect. Because the random sample consists of families with children and not families in general (some of which do not have children), the point estimate overestimates the true mean.
Correct. The estimate is based on a random sample (and is therefore unbiased) and is also based on a large sample, which makes it more accurate.
